key_channel_insights.line_content: Nearly two-thirds of OTA fares still price above OA.com and 1 in 5 website itineraries are missing, although price parity is trending up.
71% of MSE fares now match OA.com and undercuts have fallen to 29% with only a ~2% gap; no itineraries are missing or higher-priced.
OA content remains completely absent in GDS—100% ‘offer not found’ for the third straight period, eliminating both exposure and comparison pricing.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 63.7% of OTA fares exceeded OA.com last week, though the share fell 18 pts WoW.
Exact-price matches climbed to 14.5% of observations, a 67% WoW improvement.
21% of website itineraries were missing on OTAs, up 12 pts WoW and 11 pts MoM.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 20.6% of routes unavailable on OTAs, the largest friction point and still rising.
OTA-higher share dropped to 63.7% (-18.4 pts WoW) while the average premium held near 2%.
14.5% of itineraries now price identically, up 5.8 pts WoW.
OTA-lower remains just 1.3% with a 0.13% average discount—minimal revenue risk.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 64% premiums, 21% not-found, 15% parity; premiums down 18 pts WoW but inventory gaps up 12 pts.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: GR-origin itineraries show 64% OTA premiums and 21% missing offers—consistent with overall channel pattern.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Premium share highest at 66% (-15 pts WoW); missing offers 18%; undercuts 1.4%.
Premiums ease to 57.6% (-25 pts WoW) but no-show rate enlarges to 26%—greatest gap by horizon.

mse_highlights.line_content: 71% of MSE prices now equal OA.com, +32 pts WoW.
Cheap-MSE cases fell to 29%, half last week’s level; discount depth steady at 2-3%.
0% of itineraries missing or higher-priced on MSE for three consecutive periods.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 100% of website itineraries surfaced on MSE—unchanged WoW/MoM.
71% same fare, up from 39% a week earlier; strongest alignment of all channels.
29% undercutting (-32 pts WoW) with modest 2-3% discounts keeps leakage limited.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Greek short-haul shows identical split: 71% parity, 29% lower, zero higher/missing.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Domestic departures maintain full visibility and the same 71/29 parity-undercut mix.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity at 75% (+30 pts WoW); undercuts down to 25% with shallow price gaps.
Parity 64% (+35 pts WoW); undercuts 36%, still double close-in but half last week’s level.

gds_highlights.line_content: All queried itineraries returned ‘offer not found’; OA fares effectively invisible in GDS.
With 0% availability, the channel provides neither premiums nor undercuts.
100% not-found rate unchanged vs prior week and month—structural distribution issue.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Website fares missing in every GDS search across all time frames.
0% parity, 0% GDS-lower, 0% GDS-higher—metrics dormant due to absent content.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: All eight short-haul OD pairs recorded ‘offer not found’; no change WoW/MoM.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Every Greece-origin query lacked OA content, mirroring prior periods.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 211 close-in searches produced 100% not-found; flat trend.
99 far-out searches also 100% not-found; no movement over time.
